metadata.Title: CVE-2023-21106 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description: In adreno_set_param of adreno_gpu.c, there is a possible memory corruption due to a double free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-265016072References: Upstream kernel It was discovered that a race condition existed in Adreno GPU DRM driver in the Linux kernel, leading to a double-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

notes.Note: sbeattie> this affects the Qualcomm ARM Adreno GPU driver.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
